intro: Eurybiopsis hookeri var. glutinosa, commonly known as sticky eurybiopsis, is a variant of the eurybiopsis genus native to South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant is notable for its sticky secretions on the leaves, which may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
